action.primary: Promotes urination, reduces edema and unblocks painful urinary dysfunction

indications: Lin Syndrome (Damp-Heat induced painful urinary dysfunction, especially Stone Lin) and edema
As a stand-alone herb in large doses for edema due to nephritis

action.primary: Clears Damp-Heat from the Liver/ Gallbladder

incompatibilities: This herb should be monitored carefully when used in conjunction with warfarin (Coumadin) as it contains vitamin K which may reduce the anticoagulant effect of warfarin (Coumadin).
Concurrent use with diuretics such as chlorothiazide, hydrochlorothiazide, furosimide (Lasix), bumetanide (Bumex) and torsemide (Demadex) may lead to increased elimination of water and electrolytes.
